Q1140 qabsorqu хавсрах
XABSUR- [ = xabsura- ] v. t. and i. To hit or strike to gether (as cymbals); (wrestling)to strike the outside of an opponent's calves or ankles with the inner side of one's foot; to put together; to add, append; to close (as a book); to unite, combine (esp. several offices), hold an additional appointment, attach to (in service or duty); to work together, assist; to blow ( of piercing cold wind). --cu kiky. To do something jointly; to assist someone in something; to combine or hold two or more jobs or appointments. --uγsan zyil. Appendix, supplement; enclosure. --uγsan bygyde xural. The united plenum, full joint session. --uγsan ygylebyri. Dependent clause (gram. ). --un neilegsen ygylebyri. Complex sentence ( gram. ). --un tasixu. To hit and entangle a leg of an opponent with one's own in wrestling. alaγ-a --xu. To join the palms of one's hands in greeting, praying, etc. baγsi --xu. To combine teaching with other duties. bicig ijen --xu. To close one's book. γar ijen --xu. Same as alaγ-a --xu. kycy --xu. To work together, assist someone in work. mongγul kitad ysyg --uγsan nom. A book of parallel texts in Mongolian and Chinese nøkyr ijen --xu. To help one's friend.
898

Q3153 qa* t хар
XAR-A, 1 adj. and n. a) Black, dark, obscure. b) Unrefined, common, plain, vulgar; rough, unpolished. c) Profane, secular, nonclerical, lay. d) Evil, sinful, malicious, jealous, jealousy, envy. e) adj. and adv. Large; intense, heavy, violent; very. f) The ninth of the ten cyclical stems ( t'ien-kan) corresponding to Chinese jen. It precedes the names of animals of the animal cycle. g) Idiomatic uses. -- alta. Wolfram, wolframite. -- bolγaxu. To blacken, make black. See also under c). -- boru. Dark brown, dark grey; dirty. -- caγan u γazar. Distance at which one can distinguish a black animal from a white one. -- cai. Black tea with no milk. -- ciraitai. Swarthy face. -- dalai. Black Sea. -- erijen. Mottled or spotted with a black background. -- keger. Chestnut colored (of ahorse). -- kitad. Khara Kitai (his.); Chinese (derogatory term). -- modu. Larch, Larix sibirica. -- møren. Amur River. -- sily. Beef soup without vegetables. -- azilcin. Hard laborer. -- bicig. Rough copy. -- jasu. Common birth, low birth. -- jariγ-a = -- jarij-a. Colloquial language. -- kele. Colloquial language. -- yge. Colloquial language; colloquialism. -- bolγaxu. To unfrock a priest. See also under a). -- feudal. Secular feudal lord. -- kymyn. Layman; husband. -- ulus. Lay people. -- nom. Black magic. -- šasin. Shamanism. -- xargis. Brutal, barbarous. -- xour-a. Jealousy, envy. -- yile. Black deed, sin. -- yile yiledygci. Sinner. -- kølysy. Large drops of sweat. -- baγ-a nasun ece. From one's very childhood. -- boruγan. Heavy rain. -- kycy. Sheer force, violence. -- ørlyge. Very early in the morning. -- salkin. Strong or violent wind; sand storm -- morin zil. The year of the black horse (Ch. jen-wu) -- baγuxu. To regret, be sorry. -- dain. Cold war. -- nutuγ. Native place, fatherland. -- seger. Nape of the neck. -- terigyty irgen. The people (hist. ).

O1395 foikeI үгүй - -гүй
YGEI n., adj. and adv. No, not; absence, lack of; having no . . .; no matter what; [predicatively ] is not, does not, etc. As a negative it follows nouns, adjectives, and verbal nouns. As second member of a compound it corresponds to English "less." After binoms consisting of antonyms it means: both. . . and . . . --, bi jabun-a. No, I am going. -- baixu. Not to be, to be absent. -- bol[basu]. If not, or else; otherwise. -- bolγaxu. To cause to disappear; to destroy, annihilate, abolish; to kill. -- bolxu. To disappear, be destroyed, vanish; to die. -- bøgesy. If not, or else; otherwise. -- busu. Double negative used to convey positive meaning. (See examples below). -- kiky. To annihilate, destroy, "liquidate" ; to squander. ali izaγur -- . Quite some time ago. amur mendy -- . Without inquiring after somebody's health, without salutation. azil -- . Jobless. baixu -- busu. It is not that there is not; it is not that [I, etc.] don't have. bi bicigsen -- . I did not write (it). bicisi -- . Indescribable in writing. ebyl zun -- . Both winter and summer. ende tende -- . Everywhere. medeky -- busu. It is not that [I, etc.] do not know. minu -- dyr. During my absence. øgede uruγu -- gyjyky. Torunup and down. sorlyge -- jabuγsan. [He] has been gone since morning. sain maγu -- . Both good and bad, no matter whether good or bad.

Right and wrong; justice. -- døryge. Left stirrup. ( See -- tal-a ). -- ese bolxu. To die ( euph. , hist. ). -- γar. Right hand. -- geky. To approve. -- ijer. To give an undue justification; to side with someone. -- tal-a. Right side; right-hand side (of man); the side one mounts a horse, hence the left side of a horse. -- xaraxu.
